intro: Sisymbrium supinum, commonly known as the prostrate wild radish, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches a height of about 10–30 cm. The plant features yellow flowers with four petals arranged in a cross shape, typical of the mustard family. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant often forms dense mats on the ground. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been introduced to other regions, where it can become invasive in some areas.
